comments.body:
More than 2 years later, the issue is still there.
I aggree with Tom. The exception has no detail information of whats going wrong. @Pete: With the current version, the code you wrote does not produce the mentioned WinRT information.

Sure this throws an exception that can be captured, but it is a useless generic exception with no helpful references or information. This is the formula for a Big Time Waster.  So the app does not crash.  But who cares... it also will not work.
Yeah, this is weird.  I received an 'unspecified error' exception.  Having to add a FileTypeFilter to a Folder picker is bizarre.
Both of your code blocks are identical. I assume you meant to leave out the FileTypeFilter in the first example.
